div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 345px; margin-left: 51px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 345px; margin-left: 341px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 88px; height: 1px; padding-top: 345px; margin-left: 711px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 432px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 5px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 270px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

font.span: The DAS will add a user to the user pool (username:password) when a
request must include a JSON object including the username and password to register.
requests to /signin again with a JSON object.
is used for security. This will return a JSON web token
requests can be made to /auth with an attached JSON web token which will authenticate and then return the identity attached to the token

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 404px; height: 1px; padding-top: 540px; margin-left: 184px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 350px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
font-size: 18px
div.span: Will add a driver of drivername to the roster when a
request is made to /roster/{drivername}. The request must include a valid JWT (JSON web token) and the rate (p/km) that the driver wishes to charge
A driver will be removed from the roster with a
request. Again a valid JWT must be provided
request will update the rate the driver is charging on the roster. If the driver is not in the roster will return an error. Again a JWT is required
request to /roster will return the roster as a JSON object. NO JWT is required for this action

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe flex-start; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 269px; height: 1px; padding-top: 0px; margin-left: 515px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; max-height: 260px; overflow: hidden;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.h1: A GET request to /journey with a query in the format of ?origin={originLocation}&destination={destiantionLocation} will return the cheapest driver for that journey and also the price they will charge.

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 455px; margin-left: 151px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.font: The DMS will send a JWT to authenticate drivers whenever a request is made. The DAS will return the username attached to the token if valid

switch.text: The DMS will send a JWT to authen...

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe center; width: 198px; height: 1px; padding-top: 455px; margin-left: 461px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: #000000; line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.font: The JS will make a GET request to the DMS whenever a journey is being processed. The DMS will return the roster
